alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 2:33PM MDT until August 24 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Strong and slow-moving thunderstorms are creating excessive rainfall and runoff. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following county, Bernalillo. * WHEN...Until 430 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from heavy rain may cause minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 233 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Albuquerque and South Valley. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 214 and 220.
info.instruction: Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
